alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 745 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Canada, or near Williamson, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kimper and Meta around 710 PM EDT. Phyllis around 715 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Raccoon, Zebulon, Fishtrap Lake, Coal Run Village, Pikeville, Chloe, Shelbiana, Garden Village, Coal Run and Marrowbone. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 24. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 17 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
